value.title: How to create Sparklines, indicators and conditional formatting in Power BI Paginated Reports
value.excerpt: Patrick walks finishes his look at Paginated Reports in Power BI. He shows you how to create sparklines, indicators and conditional formatting within the Paginated Report using Report Builder.  LET'S CONNECT! value.title: Improve Power BI Report performance by using the filter pane
value.excerpt: If you are using slicers in your Power BI report, moving them off to the filter pane could improve performance. Patrick shows you what this could look like based on a real customer story.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba

value.title: Install and configure Power BI Report Server (May 2017 Preview)
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at how to install and configure the May 2017 Preview of Power BI Report Server. Power BI Report Server has a new standalone install experience and this product allows for Power BI reports to be rendered in the web portal along with paginated reports.  This will get you started with

value.title: Introducing Power BI Premium Gen2
value.excerpt: At Microsoft Ignite, we found out about Power BI Premium Gen2. It's now available for you to use and WOW! It has changed the game! This feature was introduced in the February 2018 release of Power BI Desktop. Mark as Date Table has been available

value.title: OData Differences within Power BI and how to refresh your data!
value.excerpt: Last week we looked at the O365 Bubble and how we use Authentication to go in and out.  This week we show it in action!  We will look at one of the limitations to the existing Power BI service and how we can actually use the new Power BI Preview service to refresh data from an OData feed using oAuth

value.title: Power BI Auditing
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at the Power BI Auditing feature that was made available a few weeks ago. I show how to turn it on and how to search. This can be helpful with understanding who is doing what within your organization.  Offical Docs: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-admin-auditing/

value.title: Power BI dataflows: One thing you probably missed with your gateway
value.excerpt: Adam looks at how you can get your gateway working with Power BI dataflows, even if you aren't an admin of the gateway. There is one thing that most people overlook. value.title: Power BI Desktop And Role-Playing Dimensions: Can you do it?
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick talks about Power BI Desktop and role-playing dimensions. Can you even do this in Power BI Desktop? Patrick shows you why one particular way is not recommended as it will cause trouble. And then show you how you can use DAX within Power BI Desktop to take this to the next level.

value.title: Power BI For Report Consumers
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at Power BI for report consumers. Those folks that maybe don't author reports, but just view reports within Power BI. We introduce some basic Power BI concepts and introduce you to areas of the Power BI service to get you familiar with the portal.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube

value.title: Using different languages with the Power BI site
value.excerpt: I look at how your browser languages affect what is displayed. This all comes down to your browsers and the language settings within. Different browsers are configured differently. Fiddler can show you what your language order is.  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1
